[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/git.rs] [Function: GithubRepo::from_str()] [Empty String Attack] Can an attacker provide empty strings for owner or repository (e.g., '/repository' or 'owner/'), passing validation but causing panics or undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/git.rs] [Function: Client::put()] [Null Byte Injection] Can null bytes in the 'name' parameter truncate paths or bypass security checks in the underlying filesystem operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/git.rs] [Function: GithubRepo::from_str()] [Unicode Normalization] Can Unicode homograph attacks in repository names allow attackers to spoof legitimate repositories and inject malicious genesis configurations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/git.rs] [Function: Client::get()] [Type Parameter Abuse] Can the generic type parameter T be exploited with unexpected types that deserialize successfully but violate semantic invariants? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/git.rs] [Function: GitOptions] [Path Validation] Are PathBuf parameters (layout_file, github_token_file, local_repository_dir) validated to prevent directory traversal or access to restricted paths? (High)
